meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or a criminal.
meanings.sent1: The town was wary of the crooks who had been causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The police were able to catch the crooks red-handed during the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The crooks tried to sneak away with the stolen cookies, but they were caught by the baker.
meanings.sent4: The crooks of the underworld always found a way to evade justice.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crooks' masks haunted the dreams of the townspeople.

meanings.definition: A bend or curve in something.
meanings.sent1: The river had a gentle crooks that added beauty to the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The road had many sharp crooks that made driving challenging.
meanings.sent3: The crooks in the tree branches created interesting shapes against the sky.
meanings.sent4: The crooks in the path led them through a hidden garden.
meanings.sent5: The crooks in the old fence gave it a unique and rustic charm.
